A Song<S>7892</S> of degrees<S>4609</S>. Out of the depths<S>4615</S> have I cried<S>7121</S> unto thee, O LORD<S>3068</S>.
Lord<S>136</S>, hear<S>8085</S> my voice<S>6963</S>: let thine ears<S>241</S> be attentive<S>7183</S> to the voice<S>6963</S> of my supplications<S>8469</S>.
If thou, LORD<S>3050</S>, shouldest mark<S>8104</S> iniquities<S>5771</S>, O Lord<S>136</S>, who shall stand<S>5975</S>?
But there is forgiveness<S>5547</S> with thee, that thou mayest be feared<S>3372</S>.
I wait<S>6960</S> for the LORD<S>3068</S>, my soul<S>5315</S> doth wait<S>6960</S>, and in his word<S>1697</S> do I hope<S>3176</S>.
My soul<S>5315</S> waiteth for the Lord<S>136</S> more than they that watch<S>8104</S> for the morning<S>1242</S>: I say, more than they that watch<S>8104</S> for the morning<S>1242</S>. <sup>I say: or, which watch unto</sup>
Let Israel<S>3478</S> hope<S>3176</S> in the LORD<S>3068</S>: for with the LORD<S>3068</S> there is mercy<S>2617</S>, and with him is plenteous<S>7235</S> redemption<S>6304</S>.
And he shall redeem<S>6299</S> Israel<S>3478</S> from all his iniquities<S>5771</S>.
